file_content.text: That's far enough.
You must know by now that no backup is coming. You're all alone down here.
Surrender your weapons, and I'll see that you are returned to Republic space.
I doubt you have the power to honor that bargain.
You can't promise that.
How about you drop your weapons now, and I'll go easy on you?
You surrender instead.
I notice that you didn't specify returning me alive.
In how many pieces?
A minor detail.
And if I don't?
You're clearly more capable than the fools at Aurek Base, but the situation is decidedly in my favor.
I know the reputation of the Jedi... and I know that they bleed and die just like anyone else.
You may be a cut above the troops at Aurek Base, but you are still just as expendable to the Republic as any other soldier.
You are no doubt very resourceful to have survived this long, spacer, but the odds are against you.
Is that a serious question? I have the best shock troops in the Empire with me, and you're all alone.
I came here to stop you. This won't end peacefully.
Forget it.
Surely you understand that this conflict is pointless? Even if you save the base, those men will die here.
One lost ship is worth more to the Republic than all the soldiers on this planet. They will never leave Hoth alive.
They can't leave Hoth, so it's better to blow them to bits?
So killing them is a mercy?
I see that we are not going to be able to have an intelligent discussion here.
I think you might be overestimating how long this search will take.
Never is a long time.
Ah, optimism that flies in the face of reality; I had forgotten what it looks like.
Neither will you.
Very well, then. I'll make this quick and painless.
